info.label: Computer Science Student
info.brief: I'm currently an undergraduate studying computer science and economics. I'm passionate about using technology to solve real problems, and I love learning new things that help me approach problems in unique ways. As a result, I always have at least one active side project and am in the process of learning at least one new thing, be it a programming language or framework or something else entirely!

projects.title: airDrive
projects.summary: Built proof-of-concept cloud storage website that combined the usability of Dropbox with the security of file sharding and end-to-end encryption.
highlights: Participated in Breakthrough-Lab, a summer entrepreneurship program at Brown University.
Buit a secure yet easy to use cloud storage solution for conusmers.
Files were sharded across a network of users' machines.

projects.title: jGrader
projects.summary: Built website that enabled high school teachers to virtually collect and grade computer science assignments.
highlights: Was used by hundreds of teachers with virtually no marketing.

projects.title: ProcessWatch
projects.summary: Co-developed process.watch, a website that assisted cloud service providers in monitoring server statuses through email-based notifications.
highlights: Sold stake to local cloud service provider.

history.summary: Teaching assistant for Accelerated Introduction to Computer Science (Fall 2016), Introduction to Software Engineering (Spring 2017), and Artificial Intelligence (Fall 2017).
highlights: Created and updated assignments for classes of over 100 students.
Guided and mentored students through assignments.

history.summary: Web development intern for Rhode Island's Office of Digital Excellence.
highlights: Sole developer of GetOutdoorsRI, a website encouraging Rhode Islanders to explore local parks commissioned by the governor's office.
Built on a Drupal site developed by the state of Missouri.

history.summary: Software developer for a small startup focused on digitizing the K-12 experience.
highlights: One of two developers that worked on SchoolBee's directory software, which is used by thousands of students and their families
Developed an automated view system in Nodejs to improve the speeds of reads from the Mongo database.
